attributes.action: Require Train Companies to refund and/or exchange advance-purchase train tickets
attributes.background: Trains do not refund or even at least exchange advance purchase tickets. There is no economic value to society or benefit to the customer for this. If people's plans change, or they mistakenly book the wrong date, they should be allowed to refund it within a certain timeframe.
attributes.additional_details: You can't get a refund on an advance purchase ticket months in advance, unless you exchange it for another advance purchase ticket at the cost of £10. This is not fair for consumers. This is simply companies trying to squeeze out every penny they can from the consumer. Megabus charge £1 to change your tickets, but trains charge £10, and if you're train ticket is around £10 - £30 anyway, on balance it's cheaper buying a new one. This would also help trains stop overreserving seats in carriages too.

attributes.action: Provide financial help for victims of domestic violence
attributes.background:
Give them the freedom to escape their situation without having to worry about the financial repercussions. Even if they own their own homes there should be support since often they would have been financially dependent on their abuser.
Freedom to escape without facing potential homelessness
attributes.additional_details: There is no financial help for people with a mortgage, even if they cant afford to pay the mortgage, have no job and no income. Temporary help would give people that safety net they need to have the courage to leave an abusive relationship without having to worry about becoming homeless. The housing register rejects applicants based on a tick box saying yes i have a mortgaged property - it takes months to sell a house and everyone deserves to have a safe home to live in.

attributes.action: abolish the housing benefit cap to stop families with children living in poverty
attributes.background: over 400,000 will be living in poverty because of the housing benefits rules this must end to give those affected a chance of living a life without the worry about not having money to give there kids a better life

attributes.action: Armed Forces Veterans should be entitled to concessionary rail travel.
attributes.background: Should have the same entitlement to discounted rail travel as serving members.
attributes.additional_details: As a Royal Navy veteran (23 years under the waves) I feel it unfair that there is no mechanism in place to obtain a railcard other than the normal route, ie Family & Friends, Disability, 16-25 or wait until I reach 60. Serving our country is an honour and requires a massive commitment for many years, so I do not feel it is too much to ask for a small token to help with travel costs, especially when none of the other cards are valid for the lone, uninjured, pre-State Pension Veteran traveller.

attributes.action: Cut the overseas budget
attributes.background: The Prime Minster Should and must cut the overseas budget by 75% and spend the money on rectifying our countries finacial parlous position, and stop the ever continuing cuts.

attributes.action: Debate the United Kingdom's recognition of Kosovo as an Independent Country.
attributes.background: I believe Kosovo was wrongly recognised as an independent country by the United Kingdom. The bombing campaign conducted by NATO in 1999 and Kosovo's separation in 2008, were unjust acts upon Serbia. This should be debated in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom wrongly recognised Kosovo's unilateral declaration of independence a day after it was declared on the 17th of February 2008. The unjust settlement was introduced without the agreement of both parties and a binding Security Council resolution. Serbia’s sovereignty was thus undermined and disrespected in the process. Therefore, the declaration of independence by Kosovo can be argued to be an unlawful secession and needs to be debated in parliament once more.

attributes.action: Close the financial support gap for students taking a leave of absence
attributes.background: We call for the Department of Work and Pensions, in line with the policy of Student Finance England, to recognise students taking a leave of absence as no longer full-time students, and thus eligible to claim benefits including Housing Benefit, Income Support, JSA, and ESA and Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Students on a leave of absence are not considered to be full-time students by SFE, so their loan and maintenance payments stop. The DWP class these students as full-time and thus not eligible for state benefits. 

Students require leave for many reasons, such as illness, disability, bereavement, care duties, pregnancy and parental leave. Current rules place these students in a vulnerable position whereby they may have access to no support at all, pressuring them to drop out of their degrees.

attributes.action: Make the House of Lords appointment process fully independent from government.
attributes.background: Peers are appointed by the Queen on the prime minister's advice. Some members are recommended by an independent body, called the House of Lords Appointments Commission, but only for non-party-political individuals. This process allows government to tip the balance in the Lords for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
The government's power to select members of the House of Lords, leaves the Chamber open to unethical appointments, for example the recent selection made by Prime Minister Theresa May, which appears to be an attempt at quelling opposing voices inside government: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-44167066
This should never be allowed. A fully independent body must be set up to elect peers to the House of Lords.

attributes.action: The N.H.S should fund properly regulated homeopathy clinics.
attributes.background: Millions around the world and in the U.K choose homeopathy instead of mainstream medicine, until recently the N.H.S funded some G.P's who prescribed homeopathic remedy's but the N.H.S has now stopped this.

attributes.action: Make 8th May 'Attenborough Day' - a bank holiday for visiting nature.
attributes.background: Sir David Attenborough is one of the greatest Britons of the past 100 years. Rather than putting him on a plastic bank note or a commemorative coin, mark his Birthday with a public holiday for getting into nature and cleaning up our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Doing good things, especially outside, makes people happier. Happier people make happier workers means greater production. It’s a win win.

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens the right to a non-binding vote on parliamentary debates.
attributes.background:
Citizens already have the right to view almost all parliamentary debates online. 

Add a simple voting mechanism for the public to vote.

Build digital infrastructure on parliament.uk which allows those with UK citizenship a non-binding vote (‘aye’/‘no’/abstain) on all debates in parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a crude solution to the issue of representative democracy versus direct democracy in the UK. 

Many citizens feel as though a vote on who should represent them in parliament every five years isn’t democratic enough.

If you think the proposed system
is better than the current system, sign this petition.

attributes.action: Introduce a national agency to perform detailed 'anti-money laundering' testing
attributes.background:
Anti money laundering (AML) checks are required by banks, and also legal advisers, accountants etc
Given a desire to reduce the UK as a destination for 'dirty money' rules could be tighter
AML checks are hard to carry out meaningfully and are already time consuming
attributes.additional_details:
A single agency could improve on the status quo by:
- removing duplication
- unbiased approach
- removing competitive pressures to cut rigour ('all our other [x] accepted this, why don't you?')
- speeding up transactions by pre-approval
- ability to see full picture of all UK investments when testing source of funds

Scheme could be self-funding by charging fees

Data security:
- replace info being gathered and held by multiple parties
- no need to disclose full details when issuing certificate

attributes.action: Stop all councils from using enforcement agencies, bailiffs and threats of court
attributes.background: Council tax and poverty don't mix! If you are unable to pay on time you will be put into debt by your council. Theres no communication with customers they pass your bill to enforcement agencies with added fees,threats of ballifs,court and jail. If you believe this shouldn't be happening please sign.

attributes.action: Have the A1 & A2 Motorcycle Licence automatically upgrade after 2 years
attributes.background:
Upgrade the A1 to a A2 after 2 years. 
Upgrade the A2 to a full licence after 2 years. 
Car drivers can drive a vehicle with any power after one test, why can't us bikers? 
At least with 2 years experience of each licence, surely that is enough experience to be given the privilege to move up.
attributes.additional_details: Bikers must complete a CBT test for a 125. Then another test for the A1 licence, that is for a 125 again. It consists of a theory test, a module 1 and a module 2. Then bikers have to wait to be older anyway to go for the A2 licence that again consists of a module 1 & a module 2 , then for the full A licence they must do another module 1 and module 2 test. To prepare for the tests, training is needed consisting at least 5 lessons costing a bomb and taking up alot your time. It's over kill.

attributes.action: Record homeless death statistics at local and national levels
attributes.background: According to the guardian, the number of homeless deaths on Britain’s streets has more than doubled since 2013, yet the extent of the problem is not known as neither the government nor local authorities are required to keep statistics on this. By understanding the problem, it can be better tackled.
attributes.additional_details: On 11 April 2018, Patrick Greenfield and Sarah Marsh wrote in the guardian that the number of homeless people dying on the streets of Britain has more than doubled in recent years, but the true extent of the problem could be much higher as there is no national or locally recorded official statistics measuring this. To better understand and help to tackle this issue, statistics on the number of deaths of homeless people on the streets of Britain should be recorded.

attributes.action: Ban people from smoking inside all local authority/ association owned houses
attributes.background:
Banning smoking in local authority/association owned houses will reduce passive smoking which other people in the property do not want to inhale. 

It will reduce the amount of fire damage that could occur if the cigarette isn't extinguished properly
attributes.additional_details:
It can stop potential nuisance of litter been thrown from windows into neighbours gardens and the street better for the environment and less encouragement to rats 

May reduce smoking rate so people may quit and become healthier

attributes.action: Issue a statement condemning democratic rights violations in Poland and Hungary
attributes.background: The Polish and Hungarian governments have undermined democracy in their respective countries. Poland has compromised the independence of the judiciary, while Hungary has restricted freedom of the press and the funding of pro-democracy NGOs. The UK Government should speak out against this.
attributes.additional_details: As evidence, we can note that the EU commission has begun proceedings against both countries due to Hungary’s violations of citizens’ rights under the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights, and Poland’s violation of the rule of law under Article 2 of the Treaty on European Union. The UK Government remains silent on the issue, when it should act to protect democracy in Europe for the sake of peace, prosperity, and justice.

attributes.action: Free Prescriptions for all under 25s in full time education
attributes.background: It is currently free for full time students aged 18 and under to get prescription medication. I’ve just turned 19 and will now have to pay for my medication whilst being a full time university student, so it may become that I cannot afford it every month and forfeit my health due to financial issues
attributes.additional_details: Many students may not see their gp due to this. I think that a valid student ID should give exemption to paying for prescriptions when being a first time student. The age limit needs raising from 18 to 25 to account for this.

attributes.action: Bring Back Capital Punishment For Convicted Terrorists.
attributes.background:
Over 30 lives have been claimed in attacks in the UK since 2016 which has left the UK terrified.
Anyone that performs terrorist attacks against the UK should be faced with capital punishment once proven guilty.
Many citizens of the UK feel a life sentence in prison isn't enough to satisfy justice.

attributes.action: Disallow Schools To Confiscate Mobile Phones
attributes.background: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate items such as mobile phones. Mobile Phone are necessary to a child's learning, it lets the student to enhance the internet, release stress, contacts friends for social support and let's parents and carers now where their child is and if they are ok.
attributes.additional_details: Yes, Phones can be a distraction meaning students must not use them in class but a teacher must not confiscate them. What are students suppose to do if they are in trouble walking home? What if they need to go to a friend's due to an emergency? What if the parent needs to contact the child but does not know where they are and who to ring?

attributes.action: Publish clearer guidance about speed limits for Vans as they are currently wrong
attributes.background:
The Road Traffic Act 1988 section 185 , 1 (b) defines the majority of van's currently on the road as a "motor car".

So schedule 6 speed limits do not apply to the majority of Vans.

I believe your guidance on Car-derived vans and dual purpose vehicles portray's incorrect speed limits for van's
attributes.additional_details:
Please see important website information and other petitions

http://bentcop.boards.net/thread/160/petition-government-clarity-speed-limits

attributes.action: Change the Yellow Box Junction Law to allow motorist to wait for upto 20 seconds
attributes.background:
The law is being misused by Local Councils as a business by installing more cameras and Yellow box junctions and generate millions by issuing tickets for few seconds.
A 20 second exemption should be given  to wait due to unavoidable circumstances and, also in the event no obstruction is caused.
attributes.additional_details: The intention of Honourable MPs for the Yellow Box junction law were not to generate money but to ensure smooth flow of traffic from the right in the event of heavy traffic on the main road. If the council were not stopped they will also convert KEEP CLEAR and T- Junctions into Yellow box junctions and will install CCTV to generate millions.

attributes.action: Have a UK passport only channel in U.K. airports.
attributes.background:
Every time I fly throughout the year I am constantly in a huge queue to enter my home country!
It is so frustrating to have a UK/EU passport channel where 75% of the people are not UK citizens. We are one of the only countries where our own citizens queue to come HOME.
attributes.additional_details:
We shouldn’t have to be in a long queue where most of those are EU not U.K. citizens. Priority should be given to British passport holders just as every other country does by having U.K. passport ONLY lanes too.
Even the queues for non EU/UK passports is often smaller and quicker and it’s really a kick in the teeth to queue when in other counties airports at the border and then also at the border when you get home!

attributes.action: Set a legal maximum stake of £2 for fixed odds betting machines (FOBTS)
attributes.background:
Problem gamblers are often troubled, vulnerable and in self-destruct mode. An addict desires to burn quickly - the 'crack-cocaine' FOBT machines facilitate this

B2 gaming/roulette can take £100 in seconds. There should be a legal maximum stake of £2 to protect people who are addicted to gambling.
attributes.additional_details:
Betting can be fun, but addiction isn't.
 
When the fun stops, stop. The fun has stopped - there are over 400,000 problem gamblers, with more than 2 million 'at risk' - so stop the FOBTs.
 
A £2 maximum stake (as already is in place on b3 games/ 'slots') would still allow serious, but stable gamblers to  win big, but not on the 'crack-cocaine' of gambling. 

We call on the Government to take this action to protect vulnerable people and to fix the problem in gambling.

attributes.action: Erase CCJ immediately from records once debts are fully paid.
attributes.background: A CCJ on record for 6 years can be the end of normal life for most. 6 months career break alone is dangerous, 6 years is destructive. That Mortgages will be lost, homes break under financial burden, people look to emigrate over a £300 registered debt is ludicrous & the judgements too easily applied.

attributes.action: Make booking fees illegal where tickets are only available from one vendor
attributes.background: Ticketing websites regularly charge customers the added cost of a booking fee when using their services despite it often being only website on which tickets are available. This enables vendors to charge whatever price they want knowing if people want the tickets they must pay the charge.
attributes.additional_details: When using sites such as Ticketmaster there is the added cost of a booking fee with the purchase of tickets. In many cases the ticket is only available from this website allowing a monopoly over their sale, this in turn leaves customers open to exploitation as vendors can charge excessive booking fees under this monopoly. Under this proposal booking fees would be banned unless tickets for the same event were on sale elsewhere creating competition among ticket vendors to offer the best price.

attributes.action: Minimum sentences for using physical violence or brandishing weapons.
attributes.background: On a regular basis my colleagues and I are subjected to physical aggression and attacked in the course of our lawful duty. We want minimum custodial sentences brought in so when we are attacked in our workplace or have weapons brandished against us we will have confidence in the justice system.
attributes.additional_details:
On 3 seperate occasions I personally have had knives pulled on me during the execution of warrants issued by HMCTS. On 2 occasions the police refused to arrest as they said there is no point and on the 1 occasion they did the offended was issued a £50.00 fine (which they never paid) with no other punishment at all. 

This is a story that is all too common in our workplace and I feel a minimum sentence should be introduced to provide justice to all frontline workers attacked or threatened.

attributes.action: End PFI in the NHS
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, are disappointed that the Prime Minister has not ruled out the possibility of US companies having any involvement in the NHS as part of a post-Brexit trade deal with the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
We are concerned that allowing such involvement will lock the British taxpayer into long-term debt, especially should any NHS trust involved require additional funding.

We are further concerned that the needs of private financiers and banks will dictate the shape, size and scale of our health services and that the high costs of PFI debt charges means that the NHS will be unable to operate as it would have done through conventional procurement funding.

We therefore call upon the British Government not only to rule out US or any other foreign company involvement in the NHS post-Brexit but to commit to no extension to or further PFI funding arrangements across all NHS services.

attributes.action: Make the National Speed Limit 80mph.
attributes.background: The motor way is used by drivers to get to further destinations quickly. Having a speed limit is already limiting its use and having an abundance of speed cameras is further limiting it. Making the NSL 80mph will at least contribute to a quicker journey time amongst all these other limitations.
attributes.additional_details:
More car accidents are had on regular roads.
Speed cameras are on many roads where crashes aren't even a problem. 
Amongst restricted parking, restricted roads and roads being flooded with traffic lights, traffic is a problem. Speed cameras further increase this as people slow down just for these cameras.

attributes.action: Keep accepting credit card payments for all tax payments
attributes.background: The Government are stopping accepting credit card payments from 13th January 2018 - please sign to keep the acceptance of credit card payments after this date.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owner

attributes.action: Stop charging for Vehicle Excise Duty
attributes.background:
The government wastes taxpayer money by collecting vehicle excise duty in the form of a tax on the car.
Instead the revenue currently generated through VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year £100 million worth of VED goes unpaid through evasion.
Car insurance and MOT details are now held on a central register so the outdated requirement to provide these documents when taxing a car is un-necesaary. 
VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold, this would create a simple and unavoidable way of collecting the revenue. It would also encourage people to buy fuel efficient cars therefore helping the environment.

attributes.action: Fund higher-level classes for profoundly gifted GCSE students
attributes.background: Many highly intelligent pupils feel abandoned by their secondary schools in the UK. Their ability to work and absorb new information at faster rate results in the majority of their time in school being unproductive, wasting time that should be spent realising their potential in academia.

attributes.action: Invest in gridscale battery storage to stabilise wholesale prices of electricity
attributes.background: Renewable energy supply has succeeded in droping wholesale MW prices into negative but without storage nothing is being done to prevent low supply periods seeing prices hikes as high as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. A stable grid, means cheaper bills for consumers and a future for energy suppliers
attributes.additional_details: On 11th June 2017 a record 70% of the electricity for the UK’s homes and businesses was low-carbon. Solar cuts the power demand for National Grid, reducing prices, while wind power also lowers prices. When renewable supply drops however wholesale prices are being ramped higher. Prices can fluctuate between less than £0 and as much as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. Battery storage facilities like the new plant seen in South East Australia would resolve this problem and save the consumer money.

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Wild Animals Act to Exotic and Dangerous Wild Animals Act
attributes.background: Amend the DWA, making it a legal obligation to possess a license for ownership of any wild or non-native species; preventing whimsical buying of animals with specialist care needs to safeguard animal welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Buying without researching care needs of specific animals is especially damaging to reptiles which suffer from ailments, like metabolic bone disease, as a result of improper husbandry. Introducing a license for exotic pet ownership should encourage people buying to understand the commitment they are undertaking, particularly if paired with expert consultation at the time of license purchase. The "EDWA" should also aim to hold accountable those involved in crimes against the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Debate the impact of Trump's visit on the UK's security and reputation
attributes.background: Since moving into the White House, Mr Trump has shown an impatience bordering on intolerance toward peaceful protests, the media and even the democratic process itself. So his visit to Britain will be an important opportunity to underline the importance of free speech and the right to protest.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for cyclists to overtake on the nearside of traffic
attributes.background:
There have recently been several cyclist deaths due to traffic turning left and not seeing the cyclist. This is a preventable by stopping cyclists from coming up the nearside of vehicles.
Stopping this behaviour will save lives.

attributes.action: Make the uk armed forces pensions tax free.
attributes.background: The current U.K. Armed forces pensions, is taxable, other services are non taxable, this should be addressed and made fair across the public sector.

attributes.action: Hold a snap election in response to Theresa May's poor leadership over Syria.
attributes.background: Theresa May's decision to approve air strikes in Syria without consulting the British parliament should not go unchallenged. Her lack of consideration has called the safety of this country into question and put innocent lives of the Syrian people in danger.

attributes.action: Create a UK disabled/pensioner's bus pass that works across the whole UK.
attributes.background: Create a bus pass, like in Scotland/England/Wales where disabled and elderly people can travel for free but make it so that it works across the whole UK, not cutting out at a certain place because it's in a different part of the UK or not working because you are not in the country your you live in.
attributes.additional_details: For example a bus pass from Scotland not working in England/Wales or Vice Versa.  A whole UK one instead or as well as so it works everywhere and borders aren't an issue.

attributes.action: Halt arms sales to Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has carried out indiscriminate airstrikes in Yemen which have resulted in thousands of civilian deaths.
attributes.additional_details: These have been allowed by the British government's licensing of £4.6bn of arms sales to the kingdom since the start of the Yemeni Civil War in 2015. Saudi Arabia's blockade of Yemen has also resulted in the worst humanitarian crisis in the world.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for security staff to have a body-worn camera.
attributes.background: Due to the nature of some security staff otherwise known as 'bouncers', it has become clear to me that a body worn camera is needed for the safety and security of both parties.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone who has been to an event of some kind knows of one or more stories of something going wrong when trying to get into the event. If evidence such as video can be reviewed then a better outcome can come of the incident.

attributes.action: Regulate supported housing and hostels.
attributes.background: We need a regulatory body to license and oversee hostels and supported housing, including checking that support workers are trained, checking that licence agreements are fair, and offering a fair and impartial complaints procedure. Currently, owners get away with treating vulnerable adults unfairly.
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable people can find it difficult to understand their rights and make complaints. Proper regulation would mean that vulnerable people would be protected without having to fight to be treated fairly. I have been discriminated against and there was nothing I could do about it. A housing charity evicted me for not engaging enough, even though I have a severe anxiety disorder and another didn't deal with a complaint fairly and wasn't impartial.

attributes.action: Debate harmful effects of Balloon releasing.
attributes.background: Plastic in the seas is becoming more widely known. Releasing balloons is harmful to the environment, affecting land animals, sea mammals, creatures and is eventually ingested by fish. Research has found it is consumed by humans and pets via micro-plastics. Beaches are littered with enough rubbish.

attributes.action: Lower the legal sex age to 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The president of the Faculty of Public Health, said the current legal limit prevented sexually active younger teenagers from getting support with issues of disease and contraception with official figures indicating that as many as a third of all 15 year olds are having sex in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would also make it easier for 15 year olds who are already having sex to obtain contraception or sexual health advice from the NHS.

attributes.action: Make car insurance companies give their "BEST PRICE" when they send your renewal
attributes.background:
I received my car insurance renewal and it went up by £100, I shopped around and got a better price, I then called my current insurers and following some haggling they dropped the premiums by 23%.
I want the government to make insurers give their "BEST PRICE" on the renewal and not make you haggle

attributes.action: Make vast changes to how the DWP treat people with mental health disorders
attributes.background:
DWP health assessments are a hellish experience for sufferers of mental health disorders. 
I suggest:
- Cutting wait time for assessments
- Own doctors do them
- DWP penalised if they cancel on the day
- Contact to be made more sensitively, in a way that won’t aggravate our conditions
attributes.additional_details: No allowances are made by the DWP for mental health conditions. They need to properly differentiate between physical and mental ability when noting our capabilities. An assessment with a stranger is incredibly difficult- it’s hard enough to tell family of our issues. Waiting for a DWP assessment is awful; weeks worrying about what’s to come. Two years now I’ve arrived and been turned away as they’re running behind, meaning I’ve had to suffer the anxiety of waiting all over again. Horrific.

attributes.action: Write off all the student loans up to the current academic year.
attributes.background:
All student loans are mis-sold. The main reasons are:
Lack of information provided at the time of agreement i.e. interest rates and the term of the loan.
No information or support provided during the term of the loan.
No communication provided after the course ended on how much is owed.
attributes.additional_details:
Student loans have been a huge scam, pulling in students by millions and selling them an idea of a cheap loan. All the loans should be written off, new regulations and guidelines should put into place from next academic year so students know what they are getting themselves into.There is a serious breach of duty of care which the government owes to us all as the loans are provided by the government.
https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/jun/04/student-loans-really-were-mis-sold

attributes.action: Make two modest but sensible precautions in case Brexit goes badly.
attributes.background:
Precaution 1.  Hold a post-Brexit referendum on whether to return to the EU.  

Precaution 2.  Ensure our Brexit Terms include the right for a "fast-track" return of the UK to the EU, ideally under pre-Brexit conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
If that new shirt doesn’t quite fit, we can return it to the shop.  To make sure we don’t lose those precious family photos, we back-up the laptop from time to time. 

So if rights-of-return and back-up plans make sense for an individual, shouldn't a nation of 65 million people have a contingency plan just in case Brexit is not the resounding success we all hope for?

No-one on either side of the argument has a crystal ball, so can we afford not to have an insurance policy in our back pocket?

attributes.action: Allow non-UK citizens to vote in general elections after 5 years of UK residence
attributes.background: We want all non-EU/non-commonwealth citizens living in the UK to have full voting rights (including in general elections) after 5 years of residence. In order to create a truly representative government we must include the opinions of these people who make up approximately 8% of the UK population.
attributes.additional_details: I recently discovered that non-EU citizens are ineligible to vote in UK general elections, and on further research that non-commonwealth citizens have no voting rights at all. It seems wrong that people who have lived and worked in the UK for a considerable period have no say in their futures. There has been a drastic increase in hate crimes towards foreigners in the UK since the Brexit vote, and making them more a part of our society can only help to make them feel more welcome.

attributes.action: Police officers should be allowed spit hoods as part of their kit.
attributes.background: At the moment police officers can only use a spit hood in the custody footprint ie in the yard, cage or in custody. Imagine having to do a hospital guard for 8 hours with someone spitting at you and constantly threatening to spit at you.
attributes.additional_details: There are significant health risks through spitting a Ukrainian police officer contracted tuberculosis in 2016 and died. You are also at risk of hep b and hep c as well as cold and flu viruses.
